resources.string: What is an IP or port?

This application detects open ports on a local network. It is capable of connecting to any host on the local network and opening TCP sockets in order to determine which ports are open. The user must specify the host IP address and a range of ports. It also comes with a handy Port Encyclopedia which allows for looking up the function of a given port.

An Internet Protocol address (IP address) is a numerical label assigned to each device (e.g., computer, printer) participating in a computer network. A port can be symbolized as a road to a destination. Ports allow devices to talk to other hosts on the internet on multiple "roads" or pathways, enabling simultaneous network communication.

In the world of computers, networking is the practice of linking two or more computing devices together for the purpose of sharing data. It is also one of the most important, if not the most important, innovation that shapes who we are today. Thanks to networking, communication around the world has become instant, and a vast amount of knowledge can now be accessed from anywhere in the world, making it one of the most influential inventions in human history known as the internet.
Look up the function of a given port number
Look up port %s on the web
Invalid entry. Ports may only range from 0 to 49151.
Error occurred while trying to parse port number. Please try again!
Invalid port entries. Ports may range from 1 to 65535.
